meanings.sent1: I will pungle for my share of the pizza.
meanings.sent2: She always pungles for her movie tickets.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to pungle for a new board game together.
meanings.sent4: He pungled for his mistake by buying her flowers.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to pungle for the charity event next week.

meanings.definition: To shell out or hand over money.
meanings.sent1: They had to pungle a lot for the repairs.
meanings.sent2: He pungled the cash for the concert tickets.
meanings.sent3: She pungled the money for the fancy dress reluctantly.
meanings.sent4: The company had to pungle a hefty sum for the damages.
meanings.sent5: Pungling for the new phone left him with little savings.

meanings.definition: To settle a debt or obligation by making a payment.
meanings.sent1: He promised to pungle the loan by the end of the month.
meanings.sent2: They pungled the rent on time every month.
meanings.sent3: She had to pungle the fine for parking in the wrong spot.
meanings.sent4: Pungling the dues brought a sense of relief.
meanings.sent5: The siblings decided to pungle their parents back for all the support.
